titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I wrote a letter of remonstrance to the Dean about yesterday's incident.

Then the doctor came, & gave me leave to travel. I went to Paddington by the 9.55 a.m., arriving at 3.25 p.m. Despairing of a taxi, I proceeded by the Tube to Trafalgar Square, and so reached Garlant's Hotel. I had my hair cut, and then had tea in the Athenaeum, where I saw Charles. He says that the choice for the West
canonry lies between Temple and Cronshaw. Then I had an interview with M
was in the Club, & I had some speech with him.

Then I walked to S. Paul's, Covent Garden, and called on Jimmie Adderley. The Rectory is a dingy place, & gave the impression of being also very dirty. He would like to be made Canon of Hereford, but I doubt whether he would be contented anywhere.
There is a 'gipsy' streak in his queer jumble of a character, which never allows him to continue in one stay for more than a few years
Then I went back to the Athenaeum, & I dined by myself. There were few people in the Club, & nobody whom I cared to talk with.
